intro: Trichera indivisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed trichera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Trichera indivisa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
